alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued September 11 at 7:31PM MST until September 11 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 731 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Kearny to 7 miles southeast of Florence to 10 miles northeast of Picacho to near Picacho Peak State Park, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 204 and 213. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 142. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Gilbert, Florence, Coolidge, Queen Creek, La Palma, Blackwater, Chandler Heights, Magma, San Tan Valley, Seville, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport and San Tan Mountain Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
